title: How to get FF to always open a link in my current tab, even if that URL is alreayd active in anotehr tab?
content: I remember being able to fix this before, but I can't find the config category for it now. Basically, no matter what is already open in other tabs, I always want Firefox to follow my directions and open whatever website I type in the URL in my current tab. I don't care if, say, Twitter is already open in an earlier tab. If I type in twitter.com, I want it to open in that tab, not switch to the previous tab. For example, there may be some sites that update regularly, but I want to hang onto the older version for a bit, so I leave it open. But then if I want to see the newer updated page, Firefox will not allow me to do it. What do I have to search for to switch to True or False to change this?
creator: accident55

title: Can't access Victorian government weather site
content:
If I try and access http://www.bom.gov.au I get an error message saying BOM doesnt support HTTPS even though I am NOT requesting a HTTPS connection. The BOM system flicks up this page http://www.bom.gov.au/akamai/https-redirect.html .#

Looking at other chat sessions, it seems the issue might be that the search is being conducted in a private window. If so, please advise how I can adjust settings to normal indows.

I'm on version 93.

Could you reply to my email please - kathy@dandkrichards.com

Kathy Richards
creator: kathy49

title: Firefox older version
content: How can I prevent Firefox requesting us to update. We have had good luck running version 78.15.0 ers with our software for printing name tags . Errors occur with more recent to latest versions. I have had no luck with information found on internet on preventing update messages. Thank you for your help.
creator: leggers2

title: FIREFOX 93 PRIVACY - When using INCOGNITO mode Firefox displays recently closed tabs?!?
content:
This is not Privacy even if not stored on disk. This should be turned off or at least add a on off option in preferences to give users a choice. Someone could see this list on a screen when open. If you do this then why not have a tab that also shows Recent History also and keep it in Memory?

I think this is a valid Privacy concern, am sure there is some way to snapshot it from a forensic program as it is stored in memory.

Anyone else have concerns or thoughts?? 

       Thank you
creator: brent.ruggles

title: Textual access to Security
content: When I open the Security page, it shows 'about:preferences#security' in the address bar, but when I paste the same string 'about:preferences#security' into the address bar, it does not open Security, but instead a Google Search Result page. Is there a text string that will open SecurityÂ ?
creator: Sebastian42

title: Sort Bookmarks
content: I want to sort bookmarks alphabetically by name that are in a folder. I hit sort, they rearrange perfectly. I close the window and they go right back to the way they were.
creator: toddgilbert

title: Printing leaves out text or is overlaid on other text
content:
This is a problem unique to Firefox. Even a page that's been supposedly formatted for printing turns out with missing text or text overlaid on other text. And it's a problem that has been occurring over many iterations of the Firefox browser.

Here's an example that prints fine in Edge and Chrome: https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/220867/falafels-with-yogurt-dill-sauce/?printview

What is the problem, and why can't/won't Firefox fix it?
creator: totaltampa

title: Can I install the latest FF alongside the old version (56)?
content: That is, I want to keep the version 56 and install the new version as a separate browser. Thanks.
creator: Ardony1

title: Firefox not syncing passwords
content:
Firefox for desktop is not syncing passwords from Firefox on Android.

I had to reinstall Windows on my PC and downloaded Firefox, but the passwords are not syncing from my Android to my PC. All my bookmarks, address, etc synced, but not my passwords. HELP!!! I do not use a master password.
creator: ravendragonwing
